thread.title: High school football roundup
thread.title_full: High school football roundup - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: High school football roundup
text:
CLASS AA
Guilderland 48, Ballston Spa 7
Player of the game: Guilderland quarterback George Marinopolous completed 11 of 16 passes for 259 yards and three touchdowns, as well as running for another score.
Stat of the game: Marinopolous and Cameron Long connected on two touchdown passes for 126 yards in a 3:28 span of the second quarter.
Play of the game: Midway through the second quarter, on Guilderland's first play of a drive, Long raced past the Scotties' secondary and Marinopolous tossed him the ball for a 62-yard touchdown.
Turning point of the game: With Ballston Spa still within 7-0, Marinopolous faked a handoff to Long and then found him coming out of the backfield for a 64-yard touchdown pass; the Dutchmen never looked back.
Notable: The victory was Guilderland's fifth by three touchdowns or more. ... The Dutchmen (5-1 overall, 3-1 Empire Division) face Shenendehowa (3-3, 3-1) next week with second place in the division on the line.
Saratoga Springs 25, CBA 24
Player of the game: Saratoga senior running back Dakota Harvey had 124 yards from scrimmage, scored two touchdowns and added a sack that sealed the comeback for the Blue Streaks.
Turning point of the game: On fourth down, losing by 5 with 2:30 to play, Saratoga's Brian Williams threw a strike to Robert Haughton 46 yards down the right sideline to set up a first down in the red zone.
Play of the game: Harvey reeled in a five-yard pass in the end zone to put the Blue Streaks up by one with 1:23 to play.
Stat of the game: Saratoga converted five fourth downs, scoring three touchdowns.
Shenendehowa 50, Albany 20
Player of the game: Nick Cosgrove scored a touchdown early in the third quarter to give Shen a 28-20 lead. He scored later in the period as the Plainsmen widened their advantage to 35-20.
Shaker 49, Bethlehem 0
Player of the game: Ronel Forde had two touchdowns — a rushing and a receiving score — to lead Shaker.
Play of the game: On the third play of the game, Brandon Barlow started the Shaker scoring with a 37-yard touchdown reception.
Stat of the game: Shaker had 410 yards of total offense to Bethlehem's 123 total yards.
CLASS A
Troy 60, Mohonasen 6
Player of the game: Nick Pastore scored four touchdowns — two rushing, one receiving and a 45-yard interception return — and he also kicked four extra points to lead Troy.
Play of the game: Leading 14-0, Troy blew open the game when Dajuan Hudson caught a 60-yard touchdown pass from Joe Germinerio.
Amsterdam 35, Averill Park 14
Player of the game: Trey Holloway threw for 122 yards and two scores and also had 78 yards rushing and a touchdown for Amsterdam.
Play of the game: In the third quarter, Holloway found receiver David Crawford on a 25-yard touchdown strike to put away the game for Amsterdam.
Stat of the game: Averill Park had a 17-play, 95-yard touchdown drive, capped by Antoneo Serrano-Cicero's five-yard run.
CLASS B
Schalmont 40, Lansingburgh 15
Player of the game: Cameron Brooks rushed 16 times for 134 yards and three touchdowns for Schalmont.
Play of the game: Derek Gamache returned a kick 75 yards for a touchdown for Lansingburgh.
Ravena 44, Hudson 12
Player of the game: Matt Ferriero, who came out of the game after the first offensive series in the third quarter, had 15 carries for 176 yards and three touchdowns and three two-point conversions to lead Ravena.
Play of the game: Ravena led 16-0 with 5:06 left in the second quarter when Mike Babcock blocked a punt and Chris Moore scooped up the ball and returned it 10 yards for a touchdown.
Broadalbin-Perth 35, Cobleskill 12
Player of the game: Broadalbin-Perth running back Vince Di Caterino rushed 18 times for 194 yards and three touchdowns.
Stat of the game: Patriots running back Connor Pingatore ran for 45 yards and two touchdowns and had an interception.
Play of the Game: Di Caterino's 54-yard touchdown run in the first quarter gave the Patriots a 14-0 lead.
Turning point of the game: Shawn Waldvogel recovered a fumbled punt at the 8-yard line that led to the third touchdown in the first half for the Patriots.
CLASS C
Stillwater 24, Coxsackie-Athens 0
Player of the game: Stillwater's Dan Morris was the workhorse on offense, rushing for 105 yards and one touchdown.
Play of the game: With 15 seconds left in the third quarter, Tyler Reyome scored on a 15-yard run to put the game away for Stillwater.
Stat of the game: Stillwater rushed the ball 47 times for 263 yards.
Watervliet 38, Holy Trinity 0
Player of the game: Collin O'Brien of Watervliet had 16 carries for 128 yards and two touchdowns.
Play of the game: Steve Lyons scrambled for a 29-yard touchdown with Watervliet facing a 3rd and 19.
Turning point of game: The Watervliet defense forced a fumble early in the third quarter which was converted into its fourth touchdown.
Greenwich 51, Mechanicville 12
Player of the game: Lukas Whitehouse rushed for 200 yards and four touchdowns to lead Greenwich.
Play of the game: Whitehouse broke a 56-yard touchdown run to give Greenwich a commanding 20-6 lead.
CLASS D
Whitehall 49, Salem 6
Player of the game: Daryl Hillman ran for 227 yards and four touchdowns for Whitehall.
Play of the game: Hillman's 64-yard touchdown run in the first quarter gave Whitehall a 14-0 lead.
Stat of the game: Hillman averaged 18.9 yards per carry.
Canajoharie 13, Warrensburg 12
Player of the game: Canajoharie defensive lineman Tangen Rush had three tackles, seven assists, a forced fumble, a recovered fumble and made the decisive defensive play to seal the win for the Cougars.
Play of the game: With 1:06 left in the game Rush burst through the Warrensburg offensive line and tackled quarterback Daniel Monthony on what could have been the game-winning two-point conversion.
Stat of the game: Cougars running back Alex DeLorenzo rushed 17 times for 121 yards and a touchdown.
NONLEAGUE
Cambridge 41, Chatham 6
Player of the game: Colton Dean had two touchdown runs to help Cambridge roll to the win.
Play of the game: Dean's 20-yard run gave Cambridge a double-digit lead in the second quarter.
Stat of the game: Cambridge scored six rushing touchdowns.
Niskayuna 20,Bishop Maginn 14
Player of the game: Niskayuna quarterback John Pfohl completed 10 of 16 passes for 127 yards and three touchdowns.
Play of the game: Pfohl hit Will Malerk with a 24-yard scoring pass in the fourth quarter to snap a 14-14 tie.
Notable: Ismail Stewart led the Niskayuna rushing attack with 88 yards on 19 carries.
Rensselaer 39,Taconic Hills 21
Player of the game: Chris Spath scored three touchdowns to lead Rensselaer.
Play of the game: After Taconic Hills cut the Rensselaer advantage to 19-15 in the third quarter, the Rams' Kyle Miano returned the kickoff 75 yards for a score.
Notable: Maurice Morrison rushed for 168 yards and three touchdowns for Taconic Hills.
